Text: Hear more from Tyrone and other honorees next week during a special, virtual #BlackHistoryMonth event: Resilience in the Face of Adversity. Register here at https://t.co/hJ0dhbxsXC.
Our final honoree for next week's #BlackHistoryMonth celebration is Tyrone Holmes, President of the Lackawanna County NAACP Branch: https://t.co/eOyEG41lgH

I'm working with my colleagues to pass legislation that would ban Members of Congress from stock trading. Senators and representatives are elected to deliver for their constituents, not use confidential information to enrich themselves.

I'm looking forward to hosting a discussion with four distinguished Black community leaders in Pennsylvania during next week's #BlackHistoryMonth event: Resilience in the Face of Adversity. Register to join me: https://t.co/kvUqdFHagG

Home care workers and caregivers make it possible for seniors and people with disabilities to receive care in their homes. They allow millions of Americans to live independently. The #BetterCareBetterJobs Act invests in their jobs.

Thomas Morris Chester (1834-1892), born in Harrisburg, was a lawyer, civil rights activist, soldier & the only Black war correspondent for a major daily newspaper during the Civil War. In 1870, ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äãhe became the first African American barrister in England. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/bisY9axJrX
This Presidents Day, we remember and celebrate America's Presidents and system of government. Since 1789, Presidents have served the Nation and guided us through both our best and worst times.

China‚Äôs trade abuses are a threat to American workers and our continued economic recovery. We‚Äôre in an economic war‚Äîwhether we want to call it that or not‚Äîand we must ensure that any and all trade bills being considered include pro-worker, pro-environment provisions. https://t.co/tVfGzGolYa

The #BetterCareBetterJobs Act is more than a transformative investment in the health and independence of our fellow Americans. It's also an investment in our economy and good-paying jobs.

America will continue to stand firm with our NATO and European allies against Putin‚Äôs aggression and disinformation. The Kremlin is overtly stoking the flames of war as pretense, from lying to the UN Security Council to the apparent false flag attack in Donbas.

Home-based care allows millions of seniors and people with disabilities to live independent lives in their homes and as full members of their communities.

My #BetterCareBetterJobs Act would help them and the hundreds of thousands on waiting lists to receive home care.

OTD in 1688, the first-ever protest against slavery made by a religious body in the Thirteen Colonies took place in what is now Philadelphia. The Germantown Quaker Petition became the first American document that called for equality regardless of race. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/c3wkUsZWph

Medicare is one of America's greatest success stories, but we need to make sure people can make the most of the benefits they've earned. That's why I'm introducing the bipartisan BENES 2.0 Act to ensure that fewer people miss the deadline to enroll. https://t.co/qYdgYO8xPO
ICYMI: Each household in the United States is eligible for four free at-home COVID-19 tests. Order yours here: https://t.co/uqzmK8KQJ1

Home care workers and caregivers perform some of the most important work in the country. Because of them, millions of seniors and people with disabilities are able to live independently in their communities.

They are heroes. #NationalCaregiversDay #thankacaregiver

Dr. James E. Foster (1880-1949) was Scranton's first Black doctor and helped lead the city through the 1918 flu pandemic, treating both Black & white patients and countering racist misinformation with medical science & a focus on social and racial inequality. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/1jJNAOrMyw
My statement on Senate Majority Leader Schumer filing cloture on the motion to proceed to the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act: https://t.co/yTyYCOHavD

When American workers are given a level playing field, they outcompete the world. But too often, non-market economies like China manipulate and rig the rules and undermine our workers. Failing to include pro-worker provisions in the final bill would be failing those workers.

I'm joining @SenSherrodBrown, @SenWarren, @SenWhitehouse and @SenBlumenthal to urge @SenSchumer and @SpeakerPelosi to prioritize pro-worker, pro-environment trade provisions in the China competitiveness bills in the Senate and House. https://t.co/rUFpNjxIX7 https://t.co/Ug7by5EpO6

Receiving home care shouldn't be a luxury. Seniors and people with disabilities should have more options. My #BetterCareBetterJobsAct invests in home and community-based services and the home care workforce providing this care.

The GOP's effort to restrict access to the ballot is a threat to democracy. When you dilute the voting power of people of color, young people and even rural voters who rely on absentee ballots, you've made it clear where you stand.

Members of Congress are sent to Washington to deliver for their constituents, not to use confidential information to enrich themselves. I support the efforts of my colleagues to ban representatives & senators from trading stocks & will work to get this legislation passed quickly.

Emory Malick (1881-1958) was born and raised in Seven Points, PA and became the first licensed Black pilot in 1912. He made his first flight the year before on July 24, 1911. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/cyuTnIXpm4

Underground Railroad Conductor William Nesbit (1822-1895) was born in Carlisle, PA & later settled in Altoona. He was instrumental in the passage of the 14th Amendment & served as the first president of the Pennsylvania State Equal Rights League.‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/ULFqA9hIL4

I'm on the Senate floor this evening to pay tribute to four esteemed Pennsylvanians who have helped their community build resilience: Tyrone Holmes. Della Clark, Julius Boatwright and Theo Braddy. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/A8gxSW92rq

On this day four years ago, 14 students and three staff at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School were murdered in a mass shooting.

The victims of Marjory Stoneman Douglas, Parkland and countless other shootings in America deserve legislative action, not just thoughts and prayers.
It‚Äôs been 40 years of #Valentines with my wife, Terese. I hope the next 40 are half as good. https://t.co/PcLtUwjveP

Right now, we have a once-in-a-generation opportunity to help working families by investing in home-based care for the millions of seniors & people with disabilities who rely on those services & for the 820,000+ on wait lists.

That opportunity is the #BetterCareBetterJobs Act.

If you're a Pennsylvania college student or recent grad interested in Senate operations, I encourage you to apply for a summer internship at one of my offices in D.C. or PA. It's a full-time, $15-an-hour way to explore a career in public service. https://t.co/shQY2lkuAy https://t.co/zAGecPTe2u

For decades, the federal government neglected the very infrastructure that helped make the United States the world's largest and most innovative economy.

Thanks to @POTUS' leadership, that's changing.

Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright August Wilson (1945-2005) was born and raised in Pittsburgh. The "theater's poet of Black America" wrote and produced several plays, including Ma Rainey's Black Bottom, Fences and more. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/0yOxqagRom
My statement on the proposals in Congress to ban Members of Congress from stock trading: https://t.co/HN5sbdfEuH

Pennsylvania ranks 33rd in terms of land mass, but we have one-third of the Nation's abandoned mine land. Thanks to the infrastructure law, the Commonwealth is receiving $244 million this year to reclaim our abandoned mines.
Later this month, I'll host a discussion with four Black community leaders in Pennsylvania. Register to join the #BlackHistoryMonth event here: https://t.co/kvUqdFYLFg

Unions built the middle class & made it possible for workers to support their families with a single job. But after decades of attacks from powerful interests, union membership is at historic lows. Millions rely on multiple jobs to make ends meet.

We‚Äîthey‚Äîneed the PRO Act now.

OTD in 1909, the @NAACP was founded "to ensure a society in which all individuals have equal rights and there is no racial hatred or racial discrimination." At 113 years old, one of the Nation's leading civil rights organizations continues to empower & inspire. #BlackHistoryMonth

Last year, I introduced the #REVIVEtheCCC Act to revitalize the 1930s era Civilian Conservation Corps to fight climate change while creating thousands of jobs. Our environment needed it then and it definitely needs it now. https://t.co/FQKJ67BK4U

Despite the challenges of recovering from one of the worst economic recessions in U.S. history, @POTUS' policies have helped create millions of jobs and the fastest GDP growth in four decades. #BidenBoom https://t.co/YM32LUzMOh

The #BidenBoom is real: More than 87% of the jobs lost since March 2020 have been regained. In fact, 6.6 million jobs have been created since @POTUS took office last year. https://t.co/YAzLV1DtKG
My #BetterCareBetterJobs Act is about protecting the independence of the millions of seniors and people with disabilities who rely on home and community-based services. It's about justice.

While we've made progress in the struggle for equal rights for all, the fight is far from over. With leading partners like @civilrightsorg, I know we will continue bending the arc of the moral universe toward justice, from voting rights to criminal justice reform. https://t.co/UMkIEAFnXw

Sadie Tanner Mossell Alexander, born in Philadelphia in 1898, was the first Black woman to receive a Ph.D. in America, earn a law degree from @pennlaw & join @pabarassn. She served on President Truman's Committee on Human Rights & was a founder of @LawyersComm. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/NAE9F2tkJN

We also need better transparency on how much we‚Äôre relying on foreign adversaries to manufacture goods that are critical to our economic and national security interests. That's the first step. The second is to make the things that drive our economy right here at home.

As our economy continues to recover from the recession, it's absolutely critical that pro-worker policies be included in the final USICA/COMPETES Act legislation. Failing to do so would deprive American workers of a fair shot to compete with the world.

American workers are the foundation of the world's largest and most innovative economy. When given a level playing field, they outcompete the world. Yet non-market economies like China manipulate and rig the rules, breaking trade laws and undermining our workers in the process.

My bill with @SenatorTimScott, the PACE Expanded Act, would streamline services and enable people with a high level of need to get the care they need, when they need it,‚ÄØin the setting they prefer. https://t.co/HQPYK45ehR

Thanks to the infrastructure law, Pennsylvania will receive $25 million this year to expand EV charging. It's the first installment of the $171 million provided to the Commonwealth and an important step in building a cleaner, more sustainable future. https://t.co/L25CThDCEV https://t.co/gqrKV9Pgok

The latest CPI data proves that we must make generational investments in families, from an expanded Child Tax Credit to universal pre-K. Inflation is a global challenge, but the federal government has the ability & responsibility to shield American families from the worst of it.

American families are feeling the crunch of rising prices at the gas pump & the grocery store as our economy roars back from the pandemic recession. Even though inflation is still projected to ease considerably by the end of the year, families need relief now. They need action.

Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, families who rely on home and community-based services are feeling the impact. It was an important first step, but we must do more to ensure millions of seniors and people with disabilities have access to these services across the Nation.

I joined @SenSherrodBrown & @senrobportman to write a letter to @SecRaimondo and @USTradeRep to express concerns about the threat to the Nation's domestic production of grain-oriented electric steel from countries that circumvent our trade laws. https://t.co/EiYExv46O0

Americans are expected to automatically know which services Medicare & Medicaid cover. They deserve a health care system they can actually use, not one rife with stumbling blocks. That's why I'm joining @SenatorTimScott to introduce legislation to reduce administrative barriers. https://t.co/tFdZNotqEf

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act included billions of dollars for abandoned mine land cleanup in Pennsylvania over the next few years. This year alone, the Commonwealth will see $244 million to clean up these sites and protect Pennsylvanians from harmful pollution.

According to @NCADV, 1 in 3 women & 1 in 4 men have experienced some form of physical violence by an intimate partner. Survivors of domestic violence and abuse have waited too long for Congress to act.

It's time to pass a strong #VAWA reauthorization bill. https://t.co/j8amB65Kbd

My #BetterCareBetterJobs Act advances the cause of justice by investing in the critical home care that millions of seniors and people with disabilities rely on to live independently in their communities.

Let's get it done.

I'm joining @RepDannyDavis to introduce the Fostering Success in Higher Education Act to set foster and homeless youth up for academic success in college. By investing in these students today, we're creating our country's next generation of leaders. https://t.co/Z0RwWQCXHV

The idea that it's "harmful" to children to even discuss the existence of LGBTQ+ people isn't just ridiculous ‚Äî it's dangerous. @TrevorProject found that 42% of LGBTQ+ youth have seriously considered suicide because of living and going to school in hostile environments. https://t.co/Z7bAAOQQkb

No one should have to choose between a paycheck and their family's health, especially during a pandemic. I joined @gillibrandny and several of my colleagues in calling on @POTUS and Congress to reinstate emergency #PaidLeave. https://t.co/KgdKZC9z8t

Workers should be given simple & reasonable accommodations while they‚Äôre pregnant, like a water bottle, a stool to sit on or a better-fitting uniform. That‚Äôs what the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act is all about: supporting pregnant women & their families. #ProtectPregnantWorkers

Since October, 70,000+ borrowers, including 1,800 from Pennsylvanians, have had their loans forgiven under the Biden Administration's PSLF waiver.

Pennsylvania is home to two of the longest operating HBCUs in the country, @CheyneyUniv and @LincolnUofPA. I stand with them today and every day and will continue working to root out and defeat the white supremacy at the core of these attacks and threats. #HBCUStrong

The recent bomb threats against Historically Black Colleges and Universities are deeply disturbing and despicable. My thoughts are with the students, faculty and staff at these schools and HBCUs across the county, who should never be subject to this racial violence. #HBCUStrong

Happy #LunarNewYear to all who celebrate! In the Year of the Tiger, I wish you prosperity and health.

Later this month, I'll host a virtual event celebrating Black community leaders from across the Commonwealth. "Resilience in the Face of Adversity" will honor their work and powerful persistence in overcoming challenges to create change. Registration opens soon, so stay tuned.

This #BlackHistoryMonth, I encourage all of us to reflect on and celebrate America's Black community. From cultural foundations to challenging our Nation to live up to its ideals, Black Americans have shaped our national identity beyond measure. https://t.co/3lE6eGkSFL

Pennsylvania's roads, bridges, airports, ports and rail network are the foundation of the Commonwealth's economy. @POTUS' infrastructure law will strengthen and enhance that foundation for decades to come.

Thanks to the infrastructure law, Pennsylvania can accelerate the cleanup of environmental hazards from orphaned oil and gas wells with an initial $104 million in funding, pending application. https://t.co/UlZHrnkjJU

Gun violence is a public health crisis that impacts thousands of Americans. That's why I joined @RepDwightEvans to introduce the Resources for Victims of Gun Violence Act last year. It's why I will continue to fight for commonsense gun reform. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/kIAVmMME11
Thanks to President Biden's infrastructure law, thousands of low-income and rural Pennsylvania families will soon be connected to high-speed internet.
I'm not giving up the fight for voting rights and neither should you.
Caregiving is one of the most honorable and important jobs in the Nation. These home care workers, largely women of color, deserve living wages and benefits.

Whether you drive to work or ride public transit, @POTUS' infrastructure law will deliver tangible, real-world benefits.

It's a boon for Pennsylvania's working families.
Happy to see more Pennsylvania representation in the White House! Welcome, Willow üê± https://t.co/eMOOZt8Pvh
Nearly 2/3 of Americans are fully vaccinated. Are you one of them? Get your COVID-19 vaccine today to protect yourself and your community. https://t.co/rtkDflLCT8

It's not just Chambersburg: millions of LGBTQ+ Americans live in states where they can legally be denied services and accommodations. We must pass the Equality Act to ensure that everyone in the United States truly has equal rights, no matter who they are or whom they love.

Receiving care at home allows millions of American seniors and people with disabilities to live--thrive--in their communities with independence. I will not stop fighting for a generational investment in their care.

This is more than an investment in locks and a dam. It's energy for the factories that keep our lights on. It's safer roads and bridges. It's reliable access to drinking water and broadband. This is just the beginning.

After decades of underinvestment, our waterway infrastructure and the 76,500 jobs it supports was at risk of failure. Thanks to $857 million from @POTUS' infrastructure law this critical point in our national supply chain will soon see long-needed enhancements and repairs. https://t.co/23EYhi3TrF

I joined @POTUS at a site that was once home to a steel mill that employed thousands. Now, it's a hub for advanced manufacturing, focused on robotics, A.I. and other 21st century innovations. The rest of the Nation could learn a thing or two from Pittsburgh. https://t.co/P8ZjvJM6eg

I was proud to show @POTUS the Steel City today. Pittsburgh and Southwestern PA adapted to a changing world by reinventing its economy while staying true to its industrial past. It didn't wait for someone else to tell them how to rebuild. https://t.co/ueGbJOCXno

This morning‚Äôs bridge collapse was terrifying, especially for the thousands who cross the Fern Hollow Bridge daily. I‚Äôm grateful for the first responders and that no one was seriously injured. But this is another reminder of the investments we need to make to keep people safe. https://t.co/4GRJAPtFXK

President Biden is right: Pittsburgh isn‚Äôt just a city *with* a future ‚Äî it‚Äôs a city of *the* future. With the infrastructure law, the Steel City is setting an example for the rest of the Nation to follow. https://t.co/E1bGg33yG8

This opinion grossly misrepresents Pennsylvania‚Äôs law and should be appealed immediately. Furthermore, this is yet another reason why the Senate must pass comprehensive legislation protecting vote-by-mail and access to the ballot. https://t.co/RLgSIVxMHf

In 2019, more than 130 Republicans joined Democrats to pass Act 77. It's a bipartisan success story and has made voting more accessible for Pennsylvanians. Our Nation is better off when more people have a say in their government, not fewer.

I'm on my way to Pittsburgh and am closely tracking the bridge collapse this morning. My office is in touch with local officials to offer support as needed.

I'm grateful for the first responders working to secure the area and I'm praying for the victims injured by the collapse. https://t.co/H7Cg8Fa0jF
I'm more determined than ever to work with my colleagues to pass legislation that protects the right to vote and safeguards our elections.
It's time we invested in families and the home and community-based services that they rely on. It's time for the #BetterCareBetterJobs Act.
